required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Risk Factors,PREvention and OutComes for CI-AKI in PatientS undErgoing PCI at Intensive Care Unit(PRECISE-ICU)
clinical_study.official_title: Risk Factors,PREvention and outComes for Contrast-Induced Acute Kidney Injury in patientS undErgoing Percutaneous Coronary Intervention at Intensive Care Unit：a Single-center Cohort Study(PRECISE-ICU)

brief_summary.textblock: A retrospective, observational study included all consecutively critically ill patients undergoing percutaneous coronary intervention(PCI) at intensive care unit (ICU) in Fujian Provincial Hospital from January 1st 2012 to December 31st 2018. The aim was to determine the incidence,risk factors,prophylactic strategy and outcomes of CI-AKI in critically ill patients undergoing PCI.

primary_outcome.description: an absolute SCr increase ≥0.3 mg/dL or a relative increase in SCr ≥50% within 48 hours of contrast medium exposure

secondary_outcome.description: congestive heart failure [CHF], bleeding, stroke, reinfarction, stent thrombosis, required renal replacement therapy, length of hospital stay, hospital costs, and mortality

other_outcome.description: mortality,stent restenosis, recurrent myocardial infarction, target vessel revascularization,stroke,bleeding,required renal replacement therapy

study_pop.textblock: All Critically ill patients undergoing PCI at ICU were enrolled

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Critically ill patients undergoing PCI at ICU
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnancy
- lactation
- end-stage renal disease (eGFR <15 mL/min/1.73 m2)
- long-term dialysis treatment
- intravascular administration of contrast medium within the last 7 or 3 days postoperatively
